Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of an Aspirator Retractor for Enhancing Cement Fixation in Hip Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to either the intervention group using an aspirator retractor or a control group with standard technique.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included 38 patients undergoing hip arthroplasty, conducted at a single orthopedic center.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to either the intervention group using an aspirator retractor or a control group with standard technique.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates whether an aspirator retractor improves cement fixation in hip arthroplasty.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was cement fixation assessed by radiostereometry and radiographic examination over a minimum of 2 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 19 patients were randomised to each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on all participants using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was no significant difference in proximal migration between groups.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
